html:
Lord of hosts. Jehovah, the mighty forester who wields a great ax, enters into the scene and prevents Assyria from destroying all his children.

lop the bough. As elsewhere in the scriptures, Assyria the nation is compared to a mighty tree (Jer. 11:16; Hosea 14:6; Rom. 11:17-24; Jacob 5). Similarly, Ezekiel wrote that "the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with fair branches, and with a shadowing shroud, and of an high stature; and his top was among the thick boughs" (Ezek. 31:3). Jehovah, the forester, chops down the tree with an ax.

high ones of stature shall be hewn down. The forester will also cut down Assyria's proud and haughty people.
